description: Re-categorize docs into base, element, forms, ui-components, blocks
context:
Beads description:
Reorganize documentation categories to match the component taxonomy.

FINAL CATEGORIES:

1) BASE - tokens + default element styles (no classes, just foundation)
   - CSS custom property tokens (spacing, colors, shadows, borders, line-heights, easing)
   - Default HTML element styles (h1-h6 elements, body, links, img, etc.)

2) LAYOUT - structural patterns
   - .layout-card, .layout-sidebar, .layout-split, .layout-three-col
   - .layout-readable, .layout-holy-grail, .full-bleed
   - .stack, .cluster, .carousel, .reel, .flex, .grid, .split, .readable

3) ELEMENT - standalone building blocks
   - .box (+ .box-ghost, .box-glow, .box-semi-gloss)
   - button/.button (+ .mini, .primary, .error, .warning, .success, .ghost)
   - table/.table
   - .callout (+ .warning, .error, .ghost, .success, .hard)
   - .circle

4) FORMS - form inputs and validation
   - input, select, textarea base styles
   - label
   - Validation states (.error, .success, .warning)

5) UI-COMPONENTS - composed components
   - .swipe (+ .stop, .full-bleed)

6) BLOCKS - full patterns
   - .header (+ .border, .sticky)

7) UTILITIES - modifier/helper classes
   - .auto-color (+ .chroma)
   - .fc (fluid container)
   - .h1-.h6 (heading styles on non-headings)
   - .fs-* (font size utilities)
   - .visually-hidden, .no-list, .row, .aspect-*
